result.execSummary:
The defendant Courtney K Garner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Attempt Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.203(2).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow through with all recommendations.

The defendant must undergo an anger management assessment and follow through with any and all recommendations. Defendant must undergo a Psychological/Mental Health evaluation and follow through with any and all recommendations.
No contact with Ariahanna McGeshick. No consumption or possession of alcohol. No entry into any bars or taverns. Defendant must not possess or consume marijuana/THC in any jurisdiction.

The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
Any money owed is to be taken from any and all prison wages or accounts at the maximum amount allowed.

records.addlTxt: State's Amended Settlement Recommendation with criminal history.
Exhibit #1 - Body cam DVD (located in small exhibit box in vault); #2 - Body cam DVD  (located in small exhibit box in vault); #3 - Criminal History
Undecided

11:00 AM Defendant Courtney K Garner in court, in custody from FC jail.  Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek in court for Courtney K Garner.  Attorney Charles James Simono in court for State of Wisconsin. State scheduled for JT there is now a resolution. State recites agreement, defendant would guilty plea to counts 1, 5, 9, 10, 11 and 12 as alleged. Counts 2, 3, 4, 6, 7 and 8 will be DRI. State joint recommendation  on counts 9, 10, 11 and 12 - 5 year sentence, 2 years of initial confinement with 3 years of extended supervision, concurrent to each other. Court concerned with count 9, does not believe that sentence is appropriate. State and Svehlek agree, count 9 would now be 3 year sentence with 18 months of initial confinement and 18 months of extended supervision. Cournt 5 - 9 months of incarceration concurrent to counts 10, 11 & 12 and count 1 would be 90 days of incarceration, concurrent to all other counts. Extended supervision conditions, if not completed in prison would be an AODA and follow through with any recommendations, anger management evaluation and follow through with any recommendations, phycological evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommendations, absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol, no consumption or possession of marijuana, no entry into any bars or taverns, FT employment, no contact with Ariahanna McGeshick and not to enter on any property occupied by her. State has provided court with exhibits #1, #2 and #3. #1 - Body cam of Captain Jeff Marvin. Exhibit #2 - Body cam of Chief Eric Bath.  #3 - Criminal history. Svehlek does not object to exhibits. Court receives all 3 exhibits. Garner pleads guilty to counts 1, 5, 9, 10, 11 and 12. Court makes sure defendant understands what it means to have a count DRI. Garner understands. Court DRI counts 2, 3, 4, 6, 7 & 8. Court has PLQ, goes over the form with the defendant, finds he is freely, voluntarily and intelligently entering his pleas, waiving his constitutional rights and right to trial. Court accepts pleas of guilty and adjudges guilty of counts 1, 5, 9, 10, 11 and 12 as alleged. State makes statement, refers the court to exhibit #3 - criminal history, plays portion of exhibit #1, advises the court of scenarios throughout the body cam footage and asks court to follow joint recommendation. Svehlek makes statement, asks the court to follow joint recommendation, sentence credit 119 days (State stipulates) and accept the terms of recommendation. Garner makes statement, remorseful. Court has considered all statements, exhibits, and all factors, will accept joint recommendation and sentences to the following: Counts 10, 11 & 12 - imposes 5 years in the WI State Prison System with 2 years of initial confinement, followed by 3 years of extended supervision. Count 9 - sentences to 2 years in the WI State Prison System with 1 initial confinement and 1 year of extended supervision. Count 5 - 9 months of incarceration. Count 1 - 90 days of incarceration; all counts to run concurrent to each other, grants 119 days of pre-conviction incarceration, not eligible for any programming. 
Conditions of extended supervision: AODA and follow through with any recommendations, anger management assessment and follow through with any recommendations, must undergo a phycological evaluation and follow through with any/all treatment recommendations, no consumption or possession of alcohol, no entry into any bars or taverns, no consumption or possession of marijuana/THC in any jurisdiction, FT employment, no contact with Ariahanna McGeshick. DNA sample with surcharges. Appeal rights, firearm and voting rights given.
Subpoena - JMC
Subpoena - AKM
and Certificate of Appearance - JM
State's Plea Agreement Cover Letter

10:03 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Courtney K Garner appeared by video, in custody from FOSO.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek appeared by video for Courtney K Garner. Garner and Svehlek have complaint, waives reading of it, has filed a waiver of right to PH. Garner agrees. Court goes thru waiver of PH colloquy, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. State has filed the Information. Svehlek has Information, waives reading of it, will proceed to ARGN and enters NG pleas. Court accepts pleas, set for JT, continues bond. Svehlek would like to address bond - asks for high signature bond for stated reasons. State - bond - objects to any reduction in bond for stated reasons (very resistive to officers, valid warrant in Milwaukee Cty, etc). Court - bond - continues bond at this point. Svehlek has filed a speedy trial demand. Court sets for JT on 9/16/22 at 8:30 AM, 1 day trial.
Jury trial scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial on September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

10:54 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Courtney K Garner appeared by video.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court, in custody. Court reviews file. Garner states he contacted SPD and is eligible, thought someone would be here today, states he filed paperwork for a signature bond. Court reviews current bond, currently at $2,000.00 cash. State - bond - objects to a reduction in bond and would like to increase bond to $20,000.00 cash for stated reasons. Court confirms address - bond - increases bond to $5000.00 cash with same conditions, sets for AIA on 6/15/22 at 10:00 AM, suggests keeping in constant contact with SPD. Defendant states he did not get a complaint. Court reviews file, was read the charges and penalties previously by the Court Commissioner, State will send over another complaint to the defendant.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Courtney K Garner

Prior: 4622 N 42 Street, Milwaukee, WI 53209

No contact with Arihanna McGeshick, no consumption of alcohol, no consumption of marijuana in any jurisdiction, must take all medications as prescribed and upon request from law enforcement defendant must provide evidentiary sample of breath and/or blood to determine presence of alcohol or drugs.

9:35 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Courtney K Garner appeared by video. Garner has not received a copy of the complaint. Court will make sure one will be sent over to him at the jail. Court reads charges and penalties. Garner thinks he understands. Court questions if he has contacted an attorney. Garner has not, questions the court if they received the letter asking for signature bond - financial and medical reasons and makes statement in regards to bond. Court advises of options for obtaining an attorney, private hire, SPD or court appointed if not eligible for SPD. Garner understands. State is asking for a increase in bond to $20,000 cash bond, no contact with A.M., no consumption of alcohol, no consumption of marijuana in any jurisdiction, Upon request from law enforcement, defendant must provide evidentiary sample of breath and/or blood to determine presence of alcohol or drugs. Current warrant in Milwaukee - 4th open felony cases and makes statement in regards to the case. Court questions Warrant in Milwaukee County. Garner makes statement in regards to that case. Court questions State on the warrant. Court will leave bond amount, adds conditions: no contact with A.M., no consumption of alcohol, no consumption of marijuana in any jurisdiction, must take all medications as prescribed and upon request from law enforcement defendant must provide evidentiary sample of breath and/or blood to determine presence of alcohol or drugs.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 1, 2022 at 10:45 am.
